key_risks: Profitability concerns due to lack of consistent profitability
Customer concentration risk with significant revenue from a small number of large enterprise customers
Intense competitive pressures from other data streaming platforms and cloud providers
Dependence on Apache Kafka and potential risks from open-source community dynamics
Macroeconomic and spending concerns impacting enterprise software budgets
controversies: Questions about the commercial use of the community version of Apache Kafka and its relationship with open-source users

sources.title: Why would someone pick apache Kafka instead of Confluent?
sources.snippet: As answered in linked post, you can add whatever external processes you want to Apache Kafka. sources.title: What is Confluent and how is it related to Kafka? : r/apachekafka - Reddit
sources.snippet: Confluent has a large number of committers and was created by the founders of Kafka (Jay, Jun, and Neha). Confluent did not create Kafka, but rather the people who created Kafka founded Confluent. Kafka has existed as an Apache project well before Confluent was founded. The Confluent docs are a superset of Apache Kafka docs since Confluent ...

sources.title: Confluent, Inc. - Wikipedia
